# Preface {-} 

This book contains labs for an introduction to statistics course. Each lab steps through the process of using the R programming language for collecting, analyzing, and using statistical data to make inferences and conclusions about real world phenomena.

## Using this Lab Book

This book follows the format used in [OpenIntro Stats](https://www.openintro.org/stat/textbook.php?stat_book=os) with modifications made to the code, examples, and instructional text by Arend Kuyper.

![Creative Commons Attribution Noncommercial ](./assets/images/by-nc.png)

The contents of this book are licensed with [Creative Commons](https://creativecommons.org/), allowing for unrestricted distribution and use with attribution.

## About the Author

Arend Kuyper is an Assistant Professor of Instruction at Northwestern University His primary work is dedicated to developing and implementing methods, techniques, and strategies for teaching statistics, especially for introductory statistics and data science related courses. He recieved a PhD in Statistics from Northwestern University in 2015.
